suncertify.db

Class LockManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.db.LockManager

  • public class LockManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Thread-safe class responsible for locking and unlocking object-oriented mapped customer records, managing and verifying the validity of security identification tokens, also known as "lockcookies".

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LockManager() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void checkSecurity(long cookie, java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<java.lang.Long,CustomerRecord> map)
      Confirms that the security identification token passed for the operation on a particular customer record is the same as is attributed to that record in memory.
      static long lock(java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<java.lang.Long,CustomerRecord> map)
      Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client.
      static void unlock(long cookie, java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<java.lang.Long,CustomerRecord> map)
      Releases the lock on a record.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LockManager

        public LockManager()

    • Method Detail

      • lock

        public static long lock(java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<java.lang.Long,CustomerRecord> map)
        Locks a record so that it can only be updated or deleted by this client. Returned value is a cookie that must be used when the record is unlocked, updated, or deleted. If the specified record is already locked by a different client, the current thread gives up the CPU and consumes no CPU cycles until the record is unlocked.

        Besides returning the "lockcookie", it also passes the "lockcookie" by- value to the the input data structure.

        If logging is enabled, it logs the entering and exiting of the operation.

        Parameters:
        map - data structure containing a mapping from the "lockcookie" to an object-oriented mapped customer record
        Returns:
        an identification security token, also known as a "lockcookie"

      • unlock

        public static void unlock(long cookie,
                          java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<java.lang.Long,CustomerRecord> map)
                   throws java.lang.SecurityException
        Releases the lock on a record. Cookie must be the cookie returned when the record was locked; otherwise throws SecurityException. Notifies other threads that are waiting to get a lock on this customer record.

        When the record lock is released the lockcookie in the input data structure is reseted to 0.

        If logging is enabled, it logs the entering and exiting of the operation.

        Parameters:
        cookie - the security identification token
        map - data structure containing a mapping from the "lockcookie" to an object-oriented mapped customer record
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if the security identification tokens don't match

      • checkSecurity

        public static void checkSecurity(long cookie,
                                 java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<java.lang.Long,CustomerRecord> map)
                          throws java.lang.SecurityException
        Confirms that the security identification token passed for the operation on a particular customer record is the same as is attributed to that record in memory.
        Parameters:
        cookie - the security identification token, also known as "lockcookie"
        map - data structure containing a mapping from the "lockcookie" to an object-oriented mapped customer record
        Throws:
        java.lang.SecurityException - if the security identification tokens don't match
